symptoms: Error code E207 displayed on screen
diagnostics: Check the gas supply is on and pressure is correct (19-20mbar)
Inspect the ignition electrode for damage or carbon buildup
Inspect the ignition lead for damage
Check resistance of ignition lead (should be 1-5kΩ)
Check for blockages in the burner
solutions: If ignition electrode is damaged: Replace ignition electrode and gasket
If ignition lead is faulty: Replace ignition lead
If gas pressure is insufficient: Check gas meter and supply
If gas valve is faulty: Replace gas valve
Reset boiler and confirm normal ignition

diagnostics: Check electrical connections to the flow sensor
Measure resistance across flow sensor terminals (should be 10kΩ at 25°C)
Check for limescale buildup in the heat exchanger
Verify water pressure is between 1-2 bar
Test PCB outputs to flow sensor
solutions: If connections are loose: Clean and secure connections
If sensor is faulty: Replace flow temperature sensor
If limescale present: Flush system with descaler
If PCB is faulty: Replace PCB
Reset boiler fault code and monitor temperature readings

causes: Wiring issue between boiler and external controls
diagnostics: Check all wiring connections between boiler and controls
Verify power supply to external controls
Check DIP switch settings match the installed controller type
Test for continuity in control cables
Test voltage across EMS terminals (should be 12-24V DC)
solutions: If wiring is damaged: Replace control cables
If external control is faulty: Replace external controller
If DIP switches are incorrect: Set to correct configuration
If interference is detected: Install ferrite cores on cables
Reset boiler and external controls and test heating functions
